# Draft:Mohammad Anwar Numyalai

----
Mohammad Anwar Numyalai (19 February 1928 – 4 October 2006) was an Afghan scholar, writer, translator, poet, and academic. He was recognized for his intellectual work in literature, philosophy, anthropology, and the social sciences, and held the honorary title of Candidate Academician.
Early life and education
Mohammad Anwar Numyalai was born on 19th February 1928 in Kandahar, Afghanistan. His grandparents were from Arghistan, Maruf districts and had moved to Kandahar. He was the son of Haji Mohammad Naeem who was known for his religious piety and business background.
Numyalai began his early education through private religious instruction, completing his studies in Islamic sciences before pursuing modern academic fields. His intellectual curiosity led him to explore both religious and contemporary disciplines, with a particular focus on philosophy, modern thought, and social analysis.
A passionate reader and linguist, he became fluent in Pashto, Persian, Arabic, English, Russian, and Danish, which allowed him to engage deeply with international academic literature..
Career and works
Numyalai was an active contributor to Afghan academic and literary circles. His writings reflected a commitment to bridging traditional Islamic scholarship with modern intellectual inquiry. Throughout his career, he published numerous articles in the  and other scholarly publications, covering a wide range of subjects in the humanities and social sciences.
Among his notable works and research topics are: ( All of these books are written in Pashto - The titles are translated in english)
* The Destiny of Nations in the Light of Scientific research
* That phase and this phase – A Travelogue
* A Study on the Anthropology of Afghanistan
* Human & Evolution (translation)
* Alf Laila – One Thousand and One Nights (translation)
* The Ethnic Groups of Afghanistan
* The History of Mythology (Effects and Influences)
* India: From the Seeds of Communism to Its Full Growth
* Theoretical Overview of the History of Pashto Literature
* Introduction to the Socio-Economic Condition of the Indus (Abasin) and Helmand Basins
* Our Revolutionary Approach to Solving National Issues
* My Intellectual Boundaries and the Confrontation with Truth
His work often explored the evolution of human thought, the relationship between faith and reason, and the cultural identity of Afghanistan in the modern world.
Death and legacy
Mohammad Anwar Numyalai passed away on 4th October 2006 in Denmark at the age of 78, due to a heart attack. His death was widely regarded as a loss to Afghan academia and culture. He is today buried in Kanadahar, Afghanistan.
He is remembered as a reflective and reform-minded intellectual who sought to integrate religious tradition with modern philosophical reasoning. His contributions to literature, education, and cultural understanding continue to inspire Afghan scholars and readers.
